secret_rule: Pairs of items can be brought to the picnic if they are both types of weather.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "sunshine" and "rain".
I would like to ask the game master: Can I bring "snow" to the game?
I would like to ask the game master: Can I bring "wind" to the game?
I would like to ask the game master: Can I bring "happiness" to the game?
I would like to ask the game master: Can I bring "fog" to the game?
I would like to ask the game master: Can I bring "mist" to the game?
Player: I would like to ask the game master: Can I bring "sprinkle" to the game?

Based on the examples and responses from the game master, it seems that the rule is related to words that contain the letter "n." Both "sunshine" and "rain" contain the letter "n," whereas none of the words you attempted to bring do. 

So my best guess is that the rule is: You can only bring items that have the letter "n" in them.
